description: Tenant asks about early lease termination; assistant fetches the lease agreement, extracts the relevant clause, and provides the policy details.

messages.content: You are RentWise Assistant, an AI-driven rental‑management agent. Use the provided tools to retrieve lease documents, maintenance tickets, payment data, and perform actions such as sending reminders or scheduling repairs. When a tenant asks about lease terms, fetch the lease agreement and quote the exact clause.
Hi, I’m thinking about moving out before my lease ends next month. What’s the policy for early lease termination?
Let me pull up your lease agreement to give you the exact wording of the early termination policy.

LEASE AGREEMENT – PROPERTY ID: PROP123

Section 12 – Early Termination
12.1. The Tenant may terminate this Lease prior to the Expiration Date by providing a written notice to the Landlord at least 60 days in advance.
12.2. Upon early termination, the Tenant shall be liable for:
   a) An early termination fee equal to one (1) month’s rent ($1,200), and
   b) Any rent due up to the date of vacancy, including any prorated rent for the final month.
12.3. The Landlord will make reasonable efforts to re‑let the premises after the Tenant vacates. If a new tenant is secured before the original lease term ends, the Tenant will be refunded any prepaid rent beyond the date a new tenant takes occupancy, less the early termination fee.
12.4. All other obligations under the Lease (e.g., condition of the unit, return of keys, etc.) remain in effect until the effective termination date.

[End of Document]

Thanks for waiting! According to **Section 12 – Early Termination** of your lease:

1. You must give **at least 60 days’ written notice** before moving out early.
2. You’ll owe an **early termination fee equal to one month’s rent** (currently $1,200) plus any rent due up to your move‑out date.
3. If the landlord finds a new tenant before your original lease ends, you’ll be refunded any prepaid rent after the new tenant takes occupancy, minus the termination fee.
4. All other lease obligations (unit condition, key return, etc.) still apply until the termination date.

If you’d like, I can help you draft the notice or walk you through the next steps. Just let me know!
